intro: Turnera tortuosa, commonly known as the zigzag plant, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Turneraceae and is characterized by its distinctive, zigzagging stems. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters, often in the late spring or early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly waxy texture. Turnera tortuosa is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and ability to thrive in a variety of conditions.
